description.plain:
Artist Julius Dubose (b. December 6, 1995), better known by the stage name A Boogie wit da Hoodie (or simply A Boogie) is an American rapper and singer from the Highbridge neighborhood of The Bronx.

The “A” in his name is short for his first name, “Boogie“ is a reference to his hometown, which is sometimes known as the Boogie Down Bronx, and “wit da Hoodie” simply comes from him constantly wearing hoodies.

A Boogie first rose to fame with the success of his underground hit “My Shit,” which was released on January 17, 2016. In February of that year, A Boogie released his debut mixtape, Artist. Then, in May, he and Don Q released Highbridge the Label: The Takeover, Vol. 1, a collaborative mixtape.

A Boogie released The Bigger Artist, his debut studio album, on September 29, 2017.

On June 20, 2018, A Boogie released his debut EP, International Artist.

On December 21, 2018, he released Hoodie SZN, his sophomore studio album, which topped the Billboard 200 Albums Chart.

On February 14, 2020, coinciding with Valentine’s Day, A Boogie released his third studio album, Artist 2.0, which was released on the four-year anniversary of the original.

Four months later, on June 19, 2020, he released the deluxe of Artist 2.0, which consisted of 9 new songs, one of which notably featured his own daughter, Melody.

songs.full_title: Still Think About You by A Boogie wit da Hoodie
songs.title: Still Think About You

description.plain:
In an interview with Genius, A Boogie explained what inspired this song:


The moment I wrote this song, I was in the process of thinking about this girl that did me wrong. I started going out with this girl for about four months. She told me she was pregnant, so I’m thinking it’s mine. At first I was buggin’ like, “Damn, I don’t want a baby.”

And then one day she disappeared on me, then I seen a picture with her and some nigga, she was pregnant and shit. I was just thinking like, “Damn this bitch really did me wrong.”


Although the song tells the story of getting angry after getting played by a sweetheart, in the end A Boogie’s romantic side shines through as he repeats the song title over and over: “I still think about you…”

In an interview with XXL, A Boogie described this track as “one of the five hits” on his debut mixtape, Artist. Revolt described it as an example of A Boogie’s “rare versatility and style that is freeflowing and allows for him to dance over […] lines of R&B”.

songs.title: Jungle

description.plain:
Track six off A Boogie Wit Da Hoodie’s debut mixtape, Artist, tells the story of Highbridge, a neighborhood in the Bronx, where A Boogie grew up. Throughout the song, A Boogie compares the neighborhood to a “Jungle”—an idea he came up with when reflecting on the issues in his neighborhood:

One day I was thinking like this is dead-ass the jungle. There was mad shit going on when I was making the song.

songs.title: Timeless

description.plain:
“Timeless” is A Boogie flowing over a smooth R&B-influenced instrumental produced by Toronto’s very own, Jaegen.

A preview of the cut was included on DJ SpinKing’s mixtape, “For the Culture,” whereas the full song made its way to A Boogie’s project, “TBA,” released October 28, 2016.

songs.full_title: My Shit by A Boogie wit da Hoodie
songs.title: My Shit

description.plain:
“My Shit” is a club banger released by up-and-coming rapper A Boogie wit da Hoodie on January 17, 2016 as a single for his debut mixtape Artist, which dropped a month later. The track finds him rapping about a woman and flexing his wealth and success over a bouncy and up-beat instrumental.

The single debuted at #98 on the Billboard Hot 100, during the week of November 5, 2016. 12 weeks later, the single peaked at #86. The track went on to become RIAA certified platinum and was listed as one of “The Best Songs of 2016” by Apple Music.

On November 17 2019, the song featured in the animated science fiction sitcom Rick and Morty, appearing in episode The Old Man and The Seat.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i2j_DJzOHIM

songs.title: Look Back at It

description.plain:
“Look Back at It” sees A Boogie interpolate the flow and rhythm from Michael Jackson’s “You Rock My World" throughout the verses and “Remember the Time” during the post-chorus.

Peculiarly, a snippet released on Boogie’s Instagram dates back to December 21, 2017, almost a year before the song’s full release.

songs.full_title: No Promises by A Boogie wit da Hoodie
songs.title: No Promises

description.plain:
On “No Promises,” A Boogie Wit Da Hoodie raps about a failed relationship and how he still treated the woman well. He talks about the spoils and setbacks of a famous lifestyle, such as not being able to make or keep promises and having desires of having one expensive watch over the other.

Boogie also touches on a fan of Boogie’s named Savannah who was shot and killed at his concert in Tim Faulkner Gallery in Louisville, KY in March 2017:

Savannah just wanted to see me perform
And got hit over stupid shit
I woke up and saw the shit right on my phone
They don’t know who the shooter is

The song samples “Deep End” by the up and coming R&B group THEY. and a portion of the verse is used as his 2017 XXL Freshman Cypher.

songs.full_title: Friend Zone by A Boogie wit da Hoodie
songs.title: Friend Zone

description.plain:
“Friend Zone“ is Bronx rapper A Boogie wit da Hoodie’s ode to females, on which he touches on his own personal definition of the term “friend zone.“ On the melodic track, A Boogie boasts about his lifestyle with multiple expensive cars and women.

The track serves as the fifth on his debut mixtape Artist, which released in February 2016.

songs.title: Numbers
songs.title_with_featured: Numbers (Ft. Gunna, London on da Track & Roddy Ricch)

description.plain:
“Numbers” is A Boogie wit da Hoodie, Gunna, and Roddy Ricch’s ode to getting their money up.

The song was originally titled “Antisocial Gangsters” according to a tracklist A Boogie posted on Twitter three days before Artist 2.0’s release but was later changed to “Numbers,” which Boogie confirmed by posting the updated version of the tracklist following the album’s release.

On January 27, 2020, an earlier version of the track leaked online without Gunna’s vocals, which hints that Gunna wasn’t initially featured on the original song but was later added in the final version.

songs.full_title: Me and My Guitar by A Boogie wit da Hoodie
songs.title: Me and My Guitar

description.plain:
“Me and My Guitar” is a standout track on Artist 2.0. The song was originally previewed in early February 2020 under the name of “Guitar Song”.

The banger focuses on A Boogie’s heartaches—a topic regularly addressed in his lyrics, notably on the rapper’s February 2016 breakout song “Still Think About You.” He reflects on how his past relationships have left him heartless and unable to engage in relationships.

songs.full_title: Say A' by A Boogie wit da Hoodie
songs.title: Say A’

description.plain:
“Say A'” is the third single from A Boogie’s debut studio album The Bigger Artist. It is the first single without a featured artist. The track is produced by Ness, an in-house producer and A Boogie’s label-mate at Highbridge the Label.

The piano is used generously in the instrumental, as well as in much of the rest of A Boogie’s discography. Keys are depicted on the cover art for both of A Boogie’s prior projects: Artist and TBA.

songs.artist_names: A Boogie wit da Hoodie (Ft. Young Thug)
songs.full_title: Just Like Me by A Boogie wit da Hoodie (Ft. Young Thug)
songs.title: Just Like Me

description.plain:
“Just Like Me” is four minutes of A Boogie and Young Thug expressing their love and desire for their significant other. On the song, A Boogie addresses his girl and explains that he can’t meet her expectations because she’s “just like him,” i.e. she has too many partners.

The track marks the second collaboration between Thug and A Boogie, following DJ Esco’s song “Showed You.” The song’s instrumental is produced by Atlanta producer Pluss for his first time working with A Boogie.

songs.full_title: Demons and Angels by A Boogie wit da Hoodie (Ft. Juice WRLD)
songs.title: Demons and Angels

description.plain:
“Demons and Angels” is the 6th track off A Boogie’s second album Hoodie SZN, and marks the first collaboration between A Boogie and Juice WRLD. A Boogie and Juice take turns rapping about fashion, guns, and the dangerous lifestyle they find themselves in, while also boasting about the positives – cash, expensive items, and women.

body.plain:
“Demons and Angels” is the 6th track off A Boogie’s second album Hoodie SZN, and marks the first collaboration between A Boogie and Juice WRLD. A Boogie and Juice take turns rapping about fashion, guns, and the dangerous lifestyle they find themselves in, while also boasting about the positives – cash, expensive items, and women.

Juice previewed A Boogie’s verse within an interview with No Jumper on September 28th, 2018.

songs.full_title: Odee by A Boogie wit da Hoodie
songs.title: Odee

description.plain:
On “Odee“, the 19th track off of Hoodie SZN, A Boogie wit da Hoodie flaunts his wealth using references to guns, cars, and expensive brands.

The term OD (pronounced o-dee) is likely a double entendre. Commonly referenced in rap culture, overdosing is when the ingestion of too many drugs – such as opioids, stimulants, or fentanyl – causes countless harmful symptoms (hallucinations, seizures, and sometimes death). However, the term “odee“ is also slang for “overdoing.“ A Boogie could be referring to either definition in this context.

The track’s production is smoothly handled by Jaegen and Young Troy, who have both previously collaborated with A Boogie on a number of tracks.

songs.full_title: 4 Min Convo (Favorite Song) by A Boogie wit da Hoodie
songs.title: 4 Min Convo (Favorite Song)

description.plain:
This is the finished version of a pre-written freestyle on Funkmaster Flex’s Hot 97 that was released 2 days before the release of the album.

The track is a follow-up to A Boogie’s “3 Min Convo” and discusses his personal problems with the Highbridge label and people neglecting his influence.

People think I’m ignoring them and so [the song] is about my lifestyle and everything I’ve been through. It’s basically just me venting and talking with a melody.

The track also partially follows a similar flow to his 2016 hit “Timeless“.

songs.title: Reply

description.plain:
“Reply” is the first officially released collaboration of A Boogie Wit da Hoodie and  Lil Uzi Vert. However, they have made two unofficial tracks in 2019, namely “Flood My Wrist” and “Nonsense.” This track features both rappers pleading for communication with their significant other.

A demo of the track titled “Babygirl” appeared online prior to this track’s release on October 29, 2019.
